name: TerraformInit
description: A task for running Terraform init to prepare Terraform for other commands
author: hashicorp

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Target Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription to run Terraform against

inputs.name: useTargetSubscriptionForBackend
inputs.label: Use target subscription for backend
inputs.helpMarkDown: Uses the target subscription to connect to the azurerm storage backend

inputs.name: targetStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Azure Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It will be used to store your backend Terraform state.

inputs.name: backendConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Backend Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription to run Terraform against

inputs.name: backendStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Azure Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a pre-existing ARM storage account. It will be used to store your backend Terraform state.

inputs.name: backendContainerName
inputs.label: Container name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container to keep the Terraform state

inputs.name: backendStateFileKey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the state file to use in the Terraform backend.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the script is run.  Empty is the root of the repo (build) or artifacts (release), which is $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)
